dxf2svg.sally
Class SvgAnimationLanguage

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.sally.SvgAnimationLanguage
public class SvgAnimationLanguage
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents the implementation of the Svg Animation Language API. This class tokenizes the config.d2s file and passes the tokens to the parser. It also contains and maintains the tables of symbols returned from the parser.

Version:
0.4 - July 23, 2004
Author:
Andrew Nisbet
See Also:
for more information on SALly grammar.

Method Detail

getLineNumber

public int getLineNumber()

getTokenNumber

public int getTokenNumber()

addSymbolTable

public void addSymbolTable(int type,
                           java.lang.String tableName,
                           SymbolTable st)
Many of the labelled lists store their information on separate heaps. This allows for variable scope, that is, two different lists can have the same variable name without a conflict or name collision. This 'space' is called a name space. For instance animation objects have their own heaps that are named after the types of animation they perform. The reference for the heap object is the animations target name like 'wires' or 'solid'.

Parameters:
type - Integer enumerated value of the type of table expected.
tableName - String name of the table; the animation or modify target name.
st - the variables and values stored that relate to that target.

size

public int size(java.lang.String nameSpace)
Search the heaps for a matching namespace and report on the size of its SymbolTable. There are five pre-defined heaps which may or may not contain any variables. The heaps, in turn, could contain any number of symbol tables. These symbol tables represent namespaces.

getKeys

public java.lang.String[] getKeys(java.lang.String nameSpace)
Search the heaps for a matching namespace and returns the keys of its SymbolTable. There are five pre-defined heaps which may or may not contain any variables. The heaps, in turn, could contain any number of symbol tables. These symbol tables represent namespaces.

getKeys

public java.lang.String[] getKeys(int heapID)
Returns a complete set of variable names from a specified namespace.

Returns:
keys, may be null if there are no variables stored or the variables from an unknown namespace are requested.

getValue

public java.lang.Object getValue(int heapID,
                                 java.lang.String listName,
                                 java.lang.String listItem)
This method will return an object form of the stored value associated with the String name. If you query a single item list you will get <none> since that is the default initial value for all stored variables.

Parameters:
heapID - Type of heap you wish to search.
listName - the name of the list within the namespace. In the case of animation, there may be many stored lists that all animate motion in the graphic. This value would the name of the animation target.
listItem - of the variable that you require the associated data to.

hasContent

public boolean hasContent(int heapID)
Reports on the whether the heap identified by the argument heap value has content or not.

Returns:
true if the heap has content, false otherwise.

getAnimation

public java.util.Vector getAnimation(java.lang.String targetName)
This method does a lookup for an animation target, and if found, returns it cast as a Vector. Valid target names are covered in the Sally documentation If the target can not be found, null is returned.

Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException - if the value stored on the heap is not a vector.

hasModifiedAttributes

public boolean hasModifiedAttributes()
Returns true if there are elements that are to have their attributes modified by a modify key word (add, change and or delete) in the config.d2s file.

modifyAttributes

public void modifyAttributes(java.util.Vector vSvges)
Takes an Object and tests whether it is:
  1. An SvgElement at all; it could also be an SvgAnimation object which is not related.
  2. An SvgElement that has a modification that uses the keyword 'implied'.
and then applies any modifier attributes. The SvgElement is checked to see if there are any matching rules for this object and if there is, apply the attribute, if not leave the Object unchanged.

modifyElement

protected void modifyElement(java.lang.Object o,
                             int heapType)
This method modifies SvgElements with the attributes from the heap identified by heapType. SvgCollections can call this method recursively. You may not modify the attributes of an animation object without either making animation objects sub classes of SvgElement or throwing in some code to handle the special requirements of SvgAnimation objects.

modifyAttributes

public void modifyAttributes(SvgBuilder svgb,
                             int heapType)
This method will apply any attributes that are destined for the root element. This is required because the <SVG> element is not like a normal collection as it would be if we used a real DOM. It is synchronized in the case that multipule threads of a conversion can run.

hasModifiedAttributes

protected boolean hasModifiedAttributes(int whichHeap)
This method returns true if the heap represented by arg heap has content that key word (add, change and or delete) in the config.d2s file.
